sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use your rear fog lights here?

feedback.metin: You may only turn on your front fog lights in this case. Rear fog lights are only allowed on when visibility is reduced to a maximum of 50 metres due to fog or snowfall. In this case, visibility is just over 100 metres. This can be seen from the hectometre posts, which are 100 metres apart. When visibility is between 100 and 200 metres, you may already switch on your front fog light, but not yet your rear fog light. If you switch on the rear fog light too early, it can blind drivers behind you.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in a built-up area?

feedback.metin: The B-1 priority sign indicates that you are inside a built-up area. The sign is placed inside built-up areas in front of an intersection and outside built-up areas after an intersection.

sorular.soru: Can you hold a mobile phone while driving?
cevaplar: Yes. But you cannot actively use it.
No. This is never allowed while driving.
Yes. But you cannot use it to make or receive calls.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. This is never allowed while driving.

feedback.metin: Holding a mobile phone while driving is prohibited, as it unnecessarily endangers other road users. This applies to anything one would hold a phone for, such as changing music, checking traffic updates, adjusting navigation, making or receiving calls, and sending or receiving text messages.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: Move to the left and signal with the full-beam headlights.
Pass the other vehicle on the right.
Keep to the right behind the car.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep to the right behind the car.

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to overtake on the right if there is no traffic jam or blocked marking. You are also not allowed to signal with the full-beam headlights to force the other to move to the right. Keep to the right behind the other car and wait until it moves to the right. Only then, overtake on the left.

sorular.soru: Which category of road users do rollerbladers belong to?

feedback.metin: Pedestrians are persons on foot and persons moving on rollerblades, roller skates, a skateboard, or a scooter, for example. People pushing a bicycle, snorfiets, moped, or motorbike by hand also fall under the pedestrian traffic category.

sorular.soru: What should you take into account if you overtake on the right here?
cevaplar: That you must give right of way to exiting drivers.
That other drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right.
That this is only allowed when there are no arrows on the road surface.
sorular.dogruCevap: That other drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right.

feedback.metin: It is not always safe to overtake on the right-hand side of a block marking. For example, many drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right. Should such a driver make a last-minute decision to exit the motorway, there is a good chance they may not see you.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit in an erf?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h in an erf. Drivers must take into account pedestrians and children playing.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: You may not park next to broken yellow lines. Stopping is allowed, which means you can load and unload goods or pick up or drop off passengers. Making a phone call is categorised as parking, which is not allowed here.

sorular.soru: Which lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: You must use dipped headlights when driving through tunnels. You must switch on the dipped headlights well in advance of entering a tunnel.

sorular.soru: How are you allowed to overtake this lorry?
cevaplar: You move to the leftmost lane in one movement.
You move to the leftmost lane in two movements.
You stay in this lane and overtake the lorry on the right.
sorular.dogruCevap: You move to the leftmost lane in two movements.

feedback.metin: Overtaking on the right is not allowed. If you want to overtake the lorry, it must be done on the left side. You are not allowed to move two lanes at once, you must do this in two movements.

sorular.soru: What should you do first in the event of a traffic accident?

feedback.metin: If you are involved in a traffic accident, ensure your own safety first. Once you are safe, alert the emergency services by calling 112. If you are calling from a mobile phone, put the call on speaker so you can stay in touch with the operator while assisting the victim. Ask bystanders to secure the traffic situation.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the tractor here?

feedback.metin: The F-3 sign means lorries are prohibited from overtaking motor vehicles, so you may overtake the tractor here.

sorular.soru: How do you transport a child under 12 years of age and less than 1.35 metres tall in the front seat as safely as possible?
cevaplar: In the three-point belt, passenger airbag off.
In a child restraint system, always put passenger airbag on.
In a child restraint system, passenger airbag off.
sorular.dogruCevap: In a child restraint system, passenger airbag off.

feedback.metin: If you are transporting a child under the age of 12, they should be seated in a child restraint system on the back seat. If the child can only be seated on the front seat, the child restraint system should still be used. The passenger airbag should also be disabled. This is not mandatory, but it is safer in most cases. Front airbags are designed for adult passengers and are far too powerful for a young child.

sorular.soru: You park here at 11:40 AM and set the parking disc at 1:40 PM. Is this allowed?

feedback.metin: If you park next to a blue line, you need to set a parking disc. You always set this at the time you started parking, rounded up to the first full or half hour. So if you start parking at 11:40 AM, you may set the parking disc at 12:00 PM. You never set it at the time you plan to leave, and may not reset it once the parking time has expired.

sorular.soru: Do you keep sufficient lateral distance here while overtaking?

feedback.metin: When overtaking a horse rider, you should keep as much lateral distance as possible. You should also overtake as quietly as possible. Never use the horn. This can frighten the horse.

sorular.soru: Where can you park?
cevaplar: Next to a solid blue line.
On the carriageway next to a cycle lane.
Next to a broken yellow line.
sorular.dogruCevap: Next to a solid blue line.

feedback.metin: Parking next to a solid blue line is allowed. However, you must use a parking disc for this. Parking next to yellow line is forbidden, regardless of whether it is solid or broken. Parking on the road next to a cycle lane is also forbidden.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a tread depth of 1.2mm in the principal grooves of the tyre?

feedback.metin: The tread depth of the principal grooves of the tyres must be at least 1.6 mm around the full circumference.

sorular.soru: Your car runs on petrol. Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: These parking spaces may only be used by electric cars while charging. So you are not allowed to park here with a petrol car.

sorular.soru: What is the authorised drawbar load for a trailer with a maximum authorised mass up to 750 kg?

feedback.metin: The maximum drawbar load of a trailer with a maximum authorised mass up to 750 kg is 50 kg. It may be higher for heavier trailers.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here momentarily to adjust your navigation system?

feedback.metin: Stopping at a lay-by next to an autoweg to adjust a navigation system is prohibited. You may only use a lay-by in the event of an emergency.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the bus?
cevaplar: Yes. This is mandatory both inside and outside built-up areas.
No. This is not mandatory if the bus is at a lay-by.
No. This is only mandatory in built-up areas.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. This is only mandatory in built-up areas.

feedback.metin: The rule that says you must give way to buses indicating that they want to leave a bus stop only applies in built-up areas. You are driving outside a built-up area, so the bus must give way to you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to run full-beam headlights here?

feedback.metin: A coach is coming your way immediately after the bend. You can tell by the headlights. In this case, you have to turn off your full-beam headlights to avoid dazzling the coach driver.

sorular.soru: What is the minimum lateral distance you should maintain?
cevaplar: At least the width of the vehicle.
At least the width of the door.
sorular.dogruCevap: At least the width of the door.

feedback.metin: When passing stationary vehicles, you should maintain a minimum lateral distance equal to the width of the door.

sorular.soru: Should you anticipate oncoming cars?

feedback.metin: The C-3 sign on top indicates that the road is closed to all drivers coming from the other side. However, when combined with the sign underneath, this only applies to lorries. Drivers of other vehicles are allowed to use this road from both sides, so you must anticipate cars approaching from the opposite direction.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use the rush-hour lane here?
cevaplar: Yes. But at your own risk.
No. There is a red cross above the rush-hour lane.
Yes. The sign indicates that the rush-hour lane is open.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. There is a red cross above the rush-hour lane.

feedback.metin: While a sign next to the rush-hour lane may indicate that the lane is open, it can still be closed by displaying a red cross on the digital signs above. This may be the case when, for example, the rush-hour lane is blocked due to a breakdown or an accident. If there is a red cross above the lane, this always means the lane is closed. You may not use a closed rush-hour lane, regardless of what other signs indicate.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Nothing. It means you have switched the lights on.
Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.

feedback.metin: This light means that there is a defect in the lighting. You do not have to stop right away, but find a safe place and stop there, for example, in a car park. Check the lighting for broken lamps and replace them if possible. Always ensure you have spare bulbs available. If you cannot replace the bulb yourself, have it replaced at a garage as soon as possible.

sorular.soru: Should you walk around the front of the passenger car to get in?
cevaplar: No. You should walk around the back of the car.

feedback.metin: If you want to get into the vehicle, it is better and safer to walk in front of the vehicle. You will then see any approaching traffic coming in and you can take that into account. The road must, of course, be free because you may not obstruct anyone by opening your door.

sorular.soru: When are you obliged to take out third-party insurance (WA-verzekering)?
cevaplar: When you are on the road in a rental car.
As soon as you drive the vehicle on public roads.
As soon as the registration number is transferred to your name.
sorular.dogruCevap: As soon as the registration number is transferred to your name.

feedback.metin: If you own a car, you must take out third-party insurance in accordance with the Dutch Motor Insurance Liability Act (Wet aansprakelijkheidsverzekering motorrijtuigen). This obligation begins when the vehicle is registered in your name in the vehicle registration register. This obligation does not apply if you drive a vehicle you are using as rent-to-own, usufruct, or other sustainable use, where you are not the owner.

sorular.soru: Can you cross the level crossing if the red lights keep flashing but the level crossing barriers remain up?

feedback.metin: If the security installation is defective, the two red lights will automatically turn on, and the bell will ring for 5 minutes. Even if the level crossing barriers do not go down, you should never cross the level crossing when the red lights are on. If this takes too long, you must take a detour.

sorular.soru: What happens to energy consumption if you drive with a bicycle carrier on the back of your vehicle?

feedback.metin: Driving with a load carrier such as a bicycle carrier, a roof rack, or a ski box increases energy consumption and has a negative impact on the environment.

sorular.soru: What is the alcohol limit for drivers with a beginner's licence?

feedback.metin: If you have a beginner's licence, stricter rules apply to alcohol consumption. The limit for beginner drivers is 0.2 per mille. Alcohol consumption in combination with drugs is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Within an erf, parking is only allowed in the designated parking space. You are parked outside of a parking space, which is prohibited.

sorular.soru: What should you do when this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.
Drive on to a safe stop and check the oil level.
Drive on to a safe stop and refill the engine oil immediately.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, you must stop as soon as possible as it indicates a problem with the oil pressure. If you continue driving, the engine may break down entirely. If it is safe to do so, check the oil yourself. If you cannot do this safely, for example because you are on a hard shoulder, call the (breakdown) emergency service.

sorular.soru: What does this light mean?
cevaplar: There is a malfunction in the side airbag.
The seat belt is not worn.
sorular.dogruCevap: There is a malfunction in the side airbag.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, it means there is a malfunction in the lateral airbag, or side airbag. This means it is not working properly. If this light comes on, driving is not allowed. You should get the malfunction fixed first.

sorular.soru: What is the difference between a cycle lane and a suggestion lane?
cevaplar: There is always a symbol of a bicycle on a cycle lane.
A suggestion lane never has a red colour.
A cycle lane is not a part of the carriageway.
sorular.dogruCevap: There is always a symbol of a bicycle on a cycle lane.

feedback.metin: A cycle lane is a part of the carriageway marked with a solid or broken line. It is therefore not separate from the carriageway, as a cycle path can be. The cycle lane must have a symbol of a bicycle on the road surface. Without this symbol it is a suggestion lane (or suggestion cycle lane). A suggestion lane may be coloured red and is also part of the carriageway, just like a cycle lane.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you find yourself behind this gritter with a snowplough?
cevaplar: Maintain enough following distance and do not pass.
Overtake cautiously if the situation permits.
sorular.dogruCevap: Maintain enough following distance and do not pass.

feedback.metin: Overtaking a snowplough can be dangerous, because there is usually a lot of snow on the part of the road you would use to overtake. It is therefore wiser to stay behind the snowplough and maintain sufficient following distance. This means you can better anticipate the snowplough’s movements, and you will brake less often. It’s also important to note that road salt is bad for your car, as it causes rust.

sorular.soru: Is the lorry allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: Combinations of vehicles with trailers longer than 7 metres and lorries, may only travel on the two right-most lanes of a motorway. The lorry is therefore not allowed to drive here.

sorular.soru: What speed difference should you take into account?

feedback.metin: Brommobielen are allowed to drive at a maximum of 45 km/h. As the driver of a passenger car, you can drive at a maximum of 50 km/h in built-up areas. The difference in speed you have to take into account is therefore 5 km/h.
